title: Comment on Steve Perry: 5 Fast Facts You Need to Know by Stephanie Korb
text:
4. Multiple Media Outlets have Praised Perry as One of the Greatest Singers in Rock History Steve Perry watching the San Francisco Giants (Getty) 
There is little doubt that Perry can sing, and he is very underrated within the rock cannon, but he has been honored from prominent musicians and publications. Brian May of Queen has called Perry “in my opinion-a voice in a million.” Former Journey band mate Randy Jackson has described Perry as “the golden voice, and went on to say that “Other than Robert Plant, there’s no singer in rock that even comes close to Steve Perry.” 
Others have gone on to call him “the singer that is most identifiable with ’80s arena rock.” Perry was voted to the Top 10 greatest rock singers of all time in a 2009 Classic Rock Reader poll, while Rolling Stone had him rated as #34 of the list of “100 Greatest Singers of All Time.” U2: 5 Fast Facts You Need to Know U2 are global music superstars. For 40 years the band has been pumping out critically and commercially successful albums and show no signs of slowing. As The Joshua Tree turns 30 in 2017, the band has recently announced a 30th Anniversary tour where they will play the album front to back every night. Click here to read more 5. Perry Did Not Perform on Stage for Nearly 20 Years From 1995 to 2014 
Perry left the spotlight for about 20 years from 1995 – 2014. His last stage performance was during the end of his Strange Medicine World Tour in 1995. During this time, Journey found a new lead singer, Arnel Pineda , a singer for a Journey cover band based in the Philipines that sounded exactly like Perry. 
In 2014, Perry came back to the stage in a surprise performance with the rock band The Eels in St. Paul, MN. He appeared for the final three songs in which the Perry fronted Eels played “Open Arms”, “Lovin’, Touchin’, Squeezin'”, and The Eels song “It’s a Motherfucker.” He played two more times with the Eels in 2014 with sets that included the three songs above, Sam Cooke’s “Only Sixteen”, and the Journey song “Lights.” Daft Punk: 5 Fast Facts You Need to Know Daft Punk revived house music in the 90's with a mix of danceable, organic, and original electronica. Their landmark album Homework launched the helmet-wearing duo into the mainstream. The group is currently teasing a tour, and with their current success collaborating with The Weeknd, we thought it was about time for 5 Fast Facts You Need to Know about Daft Punk. Brian Furman Currently lives in Tampa, FL. Brian has a B.A in English from Cleveland State University. He adores his wife and two children, everything David Bowie, and the Super Bowl-bound Cleveland Browns. January 24, 2017 9:54 am
